Sentencas: Improving the oxygen electrode performances of the single solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) is of peculiar interest as it contributes to a large extent to the cell polarization resistance.
Titulo: Overstoichiometric oxides Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr or Nd) as oxygen anodic electrodes for solid oxide electrolysis application

Sentencas: The present study focuses on alternative oxygen electrode materials: the oxygen overstoichiometric rare-earth nickelate oxides Ln(2)NiO(4+delta) (Ln = La, Pr or Nd).
Titulo: Overstoichiometric oxides Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr or Nd) as oxygen anodic electrodes for solid oxide electrolysis application

Sentencas: Their electrochemical properties are measured on three-electrode symmetrical half-cells under zero dc conditions and under anodic polarization.
Titulo: Overstoichiometric oxides Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr or Nd) as oxygen anodic electrodes for solid oxide electrolysis application

Sentencas: The electrochemical characteristics are compared to those of the usual perovskite La0.6Sr0.4Fe0.8Co0.2O3-delta (LSFC) electrode.
Titulo: Overstoichiometric oxides Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr or Nd) as oxygen anodic electrodes for solid oxide electrolysis application

Sentencas: Under polarization, in the temperature range from 600 degrees C to 800 degrees C, the Pr2NiO4+delta-based cells exhibit the highest performances.
Titulo: Overstoichiometric oxides Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr or Nd) as oxygen anodic electrodes for solid oxide electrolysis application

Sentencas: At the same anodic overpotential of 0.15 V/Pt/air, the current densities measured through Pr2NiO4+delta nickelate-based cells are more than ten times larger than those obtained with a cell based on LSCF.
Titulo: Overstoichiometric oxides Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr or Nd) as oxygen anodic electrodes for solid oxide electrolysis application

Sentencas: The modeling of the anodic overpotential phenomena (activation and concentration terms) occurring at the oxygen electrode is achieved and discussed.
Titulo: Overstoichiometric oxides Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr or Nd) as oxygen anodic electrodes for solid oxide electrolysis application
